<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Glider Form](/Feats.aspx?ID=2891) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Eidolon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=386" />
<trait label="Evolution" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=394" />
<trait label="Move" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=114" />
<trait label="Summoner" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=392" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 67 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

</column>

---

Your eidolon evolves wings, a buoyant body, or some other means to control descent. It glides slowly toward the ground, 5 feet down and up to 25 feet forward through the air. As long as it spends at least 1 action gliding each round and has not yet reached the ground, it remains in the air at the end of your turn.

<title level="2">Glider Form leads to...</title>
[Airborne Form](/Feats.aspx?ID=2933)
name: Glider Form
